validation_report.validator: Claude Code Timeline Event Validation Agent

report_summary.initial_assessment_discrepancy: The task description stated events had 'EMPTY descriptions (0 characters)' but all events actually contained detailed, comprehensive summaries. The real issue was insufficient source diversity with only 2 sources per event.
report_summary.primary_issue_addressed: Insufficient source diversity - enhanced from 2 sources to 4-5 credible sources per event

event_validations.title: Boeing Chief Technical Pilot Requests MCAS Removal from Pilot Manuals

sources_added.title: Messages show Boeing employees knew in 2016 of problems that turned deadly on the 737 Max - Washington Post
Inspector General report details how Boeing played down MCAS in original 737 MAX certification - Seattle Times

event_validations.title: Boeing Pilot Discovers MCAS System Changes, Admits Deception to FAA

sources_added.title: Boeing Pilot: 'I Basically Lied To Regulators (Unknowingly)' About Flight Control System On 737 MAX - CBS DFW
Lawyers paint ex-Boeing pilot Mark Forkner as scapegoat in 737 Max crisis trial - Dallas News

event_validations.title: Lion Air Flight 610 Crashes Due to MCAS System Boeing Concealed from Pilots

sources_added.title: Lion Air 737 MAX Final Accident Report Cites AOA Sensor, MCAS Among Contributing Factors - Avionics International
Indonesia's investigation of Lion Air 737 MAX crash faults Boeing design and FAA certification - Seattle Times
Boeing 737 Max 8 in Lion Air plane crash had close call with MCAS system - CBS News

event_validations.title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 Second Fatal 737 MAX Crash Forces Worldwide Grounding

sources_added.title: Final report on Boeing 737 MAX crash sparks dispute over pilot error - Seattle Times
Ethiopian Officials Say Faulty Boeing Software Played Role In Deadly 737 Max Crash - NPR
NTSB Publishes Additional Comments on Ethiopia's Final Report on 737 MAX 8 Accident - NTSB

overall_improvements.credibility_verification: All added sources are from major news organizations, government agencies, and official investigation reports
overall_improvements.validation_methodology: Web search research to identify additional credible sources from major news outlets, government reports, and official investigation findings

validation_notes.task_description_correction: Initial task stated events had 'empty descriptions' but all events contained detailed, comprehensive summaries exceeding 800 characters each. The actual issue was source insufficiency (2 sources each instead of target 3-4).
validation_notes.sources_quality: Enhanced with sources from Washington Post, Seattle Times, CBS, Dallas News, NPR, NTSB, and aviation industry publications
validation_notes.regulatory_capture_theme: All events maintain consistent focus on regulatory capture and Boeing's influence over FAA certification processes
validation_notes.timeline_completeness: Events cover the complete timeline from initial MCAS concealment (2016) through both fatal crashes (2018-2019)
